title: Sauska 2012 Cuvée 13 Red (Villány)
description: This wine has bright aromas of cherry, tart plum, and cherry vanilla. Flavors of cherry, pomegranate and strawberry with notes of Madagascar vanilla and aniseed are wrapped in soft tannins, and the bright finish is its own reward.

title: Lone Birch 2013 Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: Blue-fruit and spice aromas are vibrant and expressive. The palate is plush and flavorful with a supple feel, while the oak seems dialed back and the balance spot on.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Bright and fresh on the nose with crystalline aromas of lime juice, apple skins and tropical-leaning plumeria, this is a very quaffable wine. The palate shows apple and pear flesh, cut with just enough lime zest.

title: Poiema 2012 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A strong forest-floor character of juniper and damp pine needles blends with slate minerality, light cranberry, rose petals and violets on the nose of this bottling. The palate is complex and intriguingly funky, with composting rose petals, Earl Grey tea and stewed-fruit flavors.

title: Poseidon 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Well balanced, lively and delicious, this medium-bodied wine pulls together spicy oak and raspberry aromas, compelling and bright fruit flavors and a lip-smacking texture due to fine-grained tannins and good acidity.

title: Garcia Schwaderer 2012 Bravado Red (Itata Valley)
description: Deep purple in color, this Itata Valley blend of Carignan, Syrah and Garnacha is concentrated, cool and rubbery smelling, with underlying cassis and blackberry aromas. High acidity yields a scratchy mouthfeel, while flavors of lactic oak and saucy black plum finish short and choppy, with unabsorbed tartaric acidity. Drink through 2018.

title: Gérard Bertrand 2014 L'Hospitalet Grand Vin White (La Clape)
description: A blend of 40% Bourboulenc, 30% Roussanne, 20% Vermentino and 10% Viognier, this boasts a highly aromatic bouquet, with forward aromas of fresh rosemary, thyme, lemon verbena, pressed yellow flowers, pear and white melon that continue through to the lush, round palate. Hints of toasted oak and sweet spice add depth, lingering on the finish alongside touches of straw and orange peel. Complex and layered, it's approachable now but should evolve well through 2018.

title: Emile Beyer 2014 Saint Jacques Riesling (Alsace)
description: Hints of unusual citrus capture the attention: is it blood orange or green tangerine? The palate is more moderate with tart red apple freshness. Ample fruit at the center makes this dryish wine rather appetizing.

title: Epiphany 2012 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Extremely dense blackberry, black peppercorns, asphalt, grape candy and violets show on the nose of this wine from a vineyard on a hillside north of the Santa Maria Valley. The palate packs in-your-face tannins and density, with flavors of black cherry, blueberry and blackberry. Give it time, then serve with the heartiest fare.

title: Flora Springs 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: With just a handful of Malbec, this wine takes time to open before becoming juicy, herbal and elegant, expressive in tobacco and black tea. The tannins fine and dry.

title: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2013 les deux M Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Baked apple with grated orange zest makes an appetizing opening. On the palate, these are joined by ripe Mirabelle plum and luscious fruitiness. There is enough residual sugar to make this off dry but the balance is there, presenting a totally fruit-driven wine full of charm.

title: Lafond 2012 SRH Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Toasted herbs, pressed violets, cola and a touch of tar frame the nose on this wine from pioneer Pierre Lafond and winemaker Bruce McGuire. The palate offers purple-flower candy flavors, with light elderberry juice and a lifting clove-meets-mint character.

title: Domaine Zinck 2014 Portrait Riesling (Alsace)
description: Lifted notes of lemon zest and chamomile signal freshness and poise. The slender palate also stakes its reputation on lemony verve and achieves it in a light, refreshing way. Drink soon, preferably on a sunny day.

title: Domaines Schlumberger 2013 Les Princes Abbés Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Rose water and Turkish Delight are tempered by orange zest but present the abiding image of Alsace Gewurztraminer: richness and opulence countered by freshness and perfume. This is straitlaced, concentrated and finishes off dry.

title: J. Lohr 2012 Hilltop Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Bruised plum and pluot aromas mix with red rose petals and chipped black slate on the nose of this reliable bottling. The palate shows slightly sour dried cherries, more lush dried blueberries, a bit more tar and a nice twist of tobacco.

title: J. Lohr 2014 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: For those who want classically grassy and energetic Sauv Blanc flavors, this widely available bottling is perfect. Aromas of both boisterously tropical fruit and funky cut grass lead into a zingy palate of white pepper, bell pepper, cement and lime.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2013 Letzenberg Riesling (Alsace)
description: Ripe lemon with a touch of licorice haunts the nose, while the palate gives way to the full breadth of that tart but teasing lemon flavor. This is very refreshing and has a dryish, lip-smacking finish. The lingering citrus makes this a top apéritif for a lively party.

title: Arboleda 2013 Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Peppery berry aromas show a balsamic nature. This feels fully oaked and resiny, while bold, fruity flavors of ripe black grapes, plum and peppercorn finish with a wave of heavy oak and mint.

title: Babio 2012 Red (Minervois)
description: Powdery, pillowy scents of violet, iris and garrigue herbs dance alongside notes of black raspberry and cherry on the nose. More black fruit flavors unfold on the palate, alongside tight, leathery tannins and a black tea astringency. This could use some more time to harmonize; drink after 2016.

title: Market Vineyards 2011 Arbitrage Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vanilla, baking spice, cranberry and cherry aromas lead to soft, medium-bodied fruit flavors with an elegant styling. It's a very pretty representation of the vintage with good balance.

title: Carucci 2013 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a vague honey character on the nose of this wine from the historic vineyard, followed by a fresh lemon, lime-chiffon and white-flower character. The palate is clean and crisp with minerally flavors, offering Gala apple skins and tangy lime juice, but right down the middle and never overdone.

title: Casas del Bosque 2013 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of olive, herbs, spice, raw oak and berry fruits give this Cabernet a classic Chilean bouquet. Dense, jammy and concentrated on the palate, this tastes of blackberry, cassis, green herbs, pepper and chocolate. This runs smooth, herbal and chocolaty on the finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Chacewater 2012 Organically Grown Grapes Merlot (Sierra Foothills)
description: A fantastic cinnamon and red pepper character helps this full-bodied wine stand out from the crowd. It also has tasty cherry and plum flavors and firm tannins, but the spicy candy personality makes it unique and memorable.

title: Bravium 2014 Wiley Vineyard Oak Barrel Aged Blanc Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A very light cherry and strawberry flavor runs through this pale-colored, light-bodied and very fresh white wine made from red grapes. It tastes nicely dry, tangy and appetizing, and should make a great pairing with seafood and fresh cheeses.
designation: Wiley Vineyard Oak Barrel Aged Blanc

title: Bravium 2014 Wiley Vineyard Stainless Steel Fermented Blanc Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Dry and refreshing, this is a nicely balanced wine with subtle flavors like crisp apple and peach skin. The texture starts out crisp and tangy and mellows on the finish to a smooth polish. It's fun to compare this to its sister wine from Bravium aged in oak.
designation: Wiley Vineyard Stainless Steel Fermented Blanc

title: Château Ollieux Romanis 2013 Cuvée Or Red (Corbières-Boutenac)
description: The bouquet of this wine is currently a bit closed, with tight though present scents of blackberry sauce, espresso powder, leather and pressed purple flower. The creamy palate is round and full, with a crushed-velvet texture and rich flavors of black berry and plum. Hints of black pepper and char develop on the finish.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is immediate in its appeal with aromas of lime leaf, flowers and peach. It drinks off dry with a zing of acidity that beautifully frames the full-fruit flavors.

title: College Cellars 2013 Cockburn Ranch Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Ripe in style, this offers aromas of blueberry pie and spice that lead to rich, full-bodied blue- and black-fruit flavors. There's quite a bit of warmth but the wine's appeal is hard to ignore.

title: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Estate Unoaked Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: There's plenty of nuance and detail on this concrete-aged wine, with its baked apple and spice aromas and flavors. It shows a fine sense of elegance and balance.

title: Cramele Recas 2013 Selene Feteasca Neagra (Miniş)
description: Deep garnet in color, this wine features a bouquet of tobacco and vanilla with a strong dose of black plum. Red raspberry and black plum flavors are interlaced with notes of star anise and black pepper that carry on through the fruit-laden finish.
